Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service from all Staff”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne B
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Istanbul we stayed at the Grand Hyatt in the new town. The staff were excellent from the doorman to the maintenance man that reset our switchboard. Nothing was an inconvenience. Stayed with a conference group who raved about the hotel. Congratulations to the Manager and staff for making ours such an enjoyable stay. A must do is to pop over the road to the Inter Continental and enjoy a drink and the superb view from their top floor bar.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good service, high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfvoyage
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times, from the late 90's to most recently last week, and it is always a pleasure to be a guest there. The service is top-notch, and the rooms are fine. It's not the trendiest boutique hotel, but I prefer it to their sister hotel, the Park Hyatt, because the GH is better located, an easy 5-min walk to Taksim Square, a major transportation hub and lively dining and shopping district with locals until late in the evening, and it has a nice Grand Club with very high quality bite-size tidbits during their cocktail hour (18:00-20:00). I was very impressed by the improvement in the food quality there last week - yummy, imaginative, and delightful dishes. Drinks selection was fine, including a decent Spanish and Turkish sparkling wine (no champagne though). Service was excellent. Breakfast at the Grand Club was average but good enough. Service was fine but not nearly as good as the evening crew, mostly due to the consistently unsmiling and angry-looking, albeit competent, waitress. The food selection for breakfast at the restaurant on the mezzanine is much better. By the way, the hotel restaurants are currently undergoing renovations, and they have a make-shift restaurant in the mezzanine, serving all 3 meals daily. Also, you'll hear some construction noise throughout the day and into the evening (even past 19:00, even though the workers are supposed to stop by 18:00). There is a decent health club, including use of a sauna and steam room. However, their Turkish hamman is only available by reservation and for a fee, which is a shame, as it is one of the hotel's unique value propositions. I recall having a nice time using the hamman with both locals and hotel guests in the late 90's, when it used to be free and open along with the health club. Now it's just locked up most of the time. Also, the hotel has a nice outdoor pool (but no indoor pool), but unfortunately it's not heated, and I've never been able to use it during all my previous stays, even on sunny, warm days. Finally, I have to commend the staff for excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Evginka
Reviews.Content: Located in a 5 mints walk from Taksim, it's a good place to stay with easy connections to any part of the city. The hotel is very stylish. Food is great. A perfect place for busness travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place after a long flight.”
Reviews.Author: JamesStIgnatius
Reviews.Content: I had just flown from DC on the inaugural direct flight, and the Grand Hyatt sure made it a nice relaxing first night in Turkey. They have a wonderful breakfast great food and nice bar. I was a little shocked at the price of a Corona but figured I would enjoy the local beer of Turkey, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place for meetings...”
Reviews.Author: Utku67
Reviews.Content: I have been doing training seminars at the Grand Hyatt Istanbul and I have to say that I am so happy an satisfied with the team's professionality and excellent hospitality. I highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “You can never be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Yesim S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a very special meaning for me as my husband and i had got married here in 2007. We stayed here for the second time on our 5th wedding anniversary and were delighted once more. Apart from our personal reasons, Grand Hyatt is also a great choice for tourists as it has a wonderful location: in the City centre but not on a noisy spot. No need to comment on the rooms etc. as the Hotel provides the Hyatt standards.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Rodsussexuk
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels pretty much globally for my job and I have to say that this hotel was excellent in almost every way. The staff must be the best trained I have come across. They invariably smile and are very effective at what they do. Best of all though, they problem solve on the spot. As an example, I had room service one night and I had asked for two glasses of wine. When the food arrived, there wasn't enough wine in the bottle for two glasses and so the guy immediately said that this was his fault and that he would get me another glass free of charge and bring it to the room. That's what I loved. There is a problem - how can I fix it - just do whatever is necessary. The hotel itself is fine and the only thing I would say about it is that it's location isn't great for restaurants and stuff although that wasn't a problem being on business. Having said that, taxis are plentiful and reasonably inexpensive

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: nicolaciotti
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and it was fantastic. The room was brilliant and we were treated with the highest level of customer service I have experienced in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in the world , no exceptions..”
Reviews.Author: joshy666
Reviews.Content: Ok , everything about this Hotel is top notch. As you would expect. 10 / 10 ... Rooms , world class staff , location. BUT , if you like breakfast this is by far , the best . Everything you really could want for Brekkie is here. Never seen a spread like this. Anywhere. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: FrankFurness
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with excellent service. The club rooms and facilities are great, free internet and a really good selection of snacks and drinks between 6 and 8 pm. The location is good, a short walk from shops a nd restuarants and a cab ride to anywhere in the city (inexpensive). Top shopping for leather goods and you must visit the Grand Bazaar. The gym is well equiped and 24 hours. Excellent pool, but too cold right now to use.

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to get some smiles”
Reviews.Author: whereswally2010
Reviews.Content: Facilities at the hotel are very good. Club lounge very good and service is functional. But the staff really do need to lern to relax and get some genuine hospitality, especially the sour faced lady on the club flor that checked us in and was in attendance for the next 5 days of our stay, but refused to smile or acknowledge us by name the whole time. We felt like we were checking in to a Turkish prison with Olga the Orrible warden.. If staff are not happy n the hospitality industry........LEAVE. The air conditioning / heating is incredibly dry, making for an uncomfortable sleep for me. No iron or ironing birds in rooms, which some european hotels still fail to acknowledge the need for, but when one was delivered (thank you) it was the oldest rustiness poorest excuse for an ironing board I have ever seen. GM, these things cost about $50, get some decent ones.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Arash723
Reviews.Content: I was there 3 times very nice place service is perfect rooms are comfortable and location near taghsim sq is really a positive point

Reviews.Title: “Top top top hotel”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye38
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights in this hotel and i loved it. I actually hated leaving. The breakfast in the morning, my god, it is out of this world, so much choice and staff are very very helpful at breakfast time. In fact the staff are helpful 24 hours a day, no matter what part of the hotel you are in, if you want something - no problem. Thats what i love about the top hotels. The swimming pool is very nice, i swam twice a day every day. The hotel is very clean and it is beautiful all around, you feel so relaxed all the time. What i liked most was the quiet location of the hotel and yet you walk 2 minutes towards the city turn a corner and you are in a busy area. This hotel is a must, the top hotels are all in the same area as this hotel and yet if i was to go to Istanbul again i would pick this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hamman heaven”
Reviews.Author: jillypops55
Reviews.Content: Rooms very comfortable. No problem when we asked for extra pillows. Lovely fresh fruit in room each day. Try the Hamman experience and the Gaia massage at the Gaia spa, truly wonderful. Cocktails to die for and fabulous breakfast. Worth a visit even in the snow.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Gsf222
Reviews.Content: Very Beautiful room and excellent services. The best spa services i met

Reviews.Title: “Striking”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is elegant, comfortable and perfect for 'events' like conferences or training courses. Expensive I guess, but really recommendable. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Clean and great Location!”
Reviews.Author: stars1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while we where there for a friends wedding. This is back in 2008. We are going again and we are staying there again. The rooms are very big, the service is fantastic, everything is nice. BUT...here is the but. Since its an American hotel, you have to go through a metal detector everytime you enter the hotel. Also cars go through metal detectors...that gave us a sense of not feeling safe there...to be honest. but then again, if you are looking for a place that has all the standards of the American hotels, this is your place. The hotel is very very nice and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LaIIslaBonita
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well situated closed to the main places and not far from the old city. the room are really nice and big. Modern style and not noisy. breakfast is fantastic, lot of choice, a chef for the pancakes and omlettes the SPA is beautiful, the Tirkish bath was a real relaxing moment i do recommande this hotel a lot

Reviews.Title: “Dedication to customer service”
Reviews.Author: Georgia33432
Reviews.Content: Our stay was truly outstanding, including our comfortable room overlooking the Sea of Marmara, breakfast buffet, and dinner at the hotelâ€™s Italian restaurant. But I especially want to acknowledge the front-desk and concierge staff for their excellent service and friendly attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kassiopea
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at 5 min by walking from Taksim square and Istiklal cad., the rooms/bathrooms are spacious and there s a beautiful outdoor pool. I loved the fresh flowers in the lobby and the room service. glamorous.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: Farha M
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to arrive in IST, to start a 5 day holiday with our 1 year old son. I researched many hotels on Trip advisor and felt that this hotel would be a suitable 5 star within our budget. However I was quite disappointed upon arrival. I felt the overall ambience was very somber and dull and a lively place to be at all. The executive lounge was just ok. There were not many breakfast items to choose from, the staff male morning staff was not the most pleasant. Did not greet with a warm good morning and I even got a weird look when I asked for a high-chair for my one year old son. The room was very clean, a bit on the smaller size, or perhaps there was just too much furniture in the room. The shower was very confining and way to small, a poor design in my opinion. We had a issue with our A/C unit which would not turn off. They did attend to it right away and then it worked fine. We did consider the Four Seasons/Sultanahmet and after visiting there for tea, I felt it would have been a better option for us. More friendly staff and a overall more well receiving attitude from their staff and vibrant atmosphere to be in. I felt that the Hyatt staff lacked friendliness, warmth and did not care too much about their guests. We also encountered many issues with Taxi driver overcharging, and cheating so beware!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - exceptional breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Bali_turis
Reviews.Content: Very handy location. Just a short walk to Taksim Metro and all shopping / cafes in the pedestrian mall. Buffet breakfast has a large variety of items and food items that should have been hot were actually hot and all food was of high quality. Room was a good size. I had a connecting room and one morning I could hear the occupant of the room next door snoring, so a bit more insulation would be nice. Wireless internet in the room was inconsistent and I could only get a signal sitting at the desk, which was slow anyway, so spent all my computer time sitting at the desk plugged in to the internet cable. The business centre was efficient. I had mixed experience with the concierge, a male employee was bordering on rude insisting that I take a taxi when I asked for directions to an appointment using public transport. A female employee was exceptionally helpful one morning when I was asking for directions to a business appointment that I could walk to. Check in and out was professional and efficient as was their airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: brigita s
Reviews.Content: Excelent accomodation, perfect location- Taksim. Great food.

Reviews.Title: “A sanctuary!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharara1982
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel , at a great location in Taksim... a short walking distance from hotel to anywhere in Taksim area.... Once my family and I arrrived to the hotel , we were upgraded to an executive suite... The breakfast at the hotel is so good,lots of varieties... and since we were upgraded to the Executive sweet we were able to access the executive lounge, the food served there is just fabulous!! the people working there are so friendly! everything is just wonderful about this hotel!!! Rooms and bathrooms are very clean.. anything you request via the house keeping is brought in to you within minutes...

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: Gionni R
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel,service and personnel. Great breakfast buffet! Very beautiful rooms,small problem with air conditioning still great and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with good food”
Reviews.Author: norm5Seattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed on three different occasions in October and each stay was very good. Hotel is clean with very nice rooms. What sets it apart is the food. We had dinner at the Agora on all three occasions and indulged in the great buffet. Really enjoyed the wide selection and the kebab station. Would stay here just for the buffet, but service is also quite good and I got a lot of help with travel arrangements from the business center. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: YodadogSFSD
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the hotel at the beginning of a three week tour of Turkey. This hotel was by far the nicest we stayed at while touring the country. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide varitey of options. The poolside bar and resturant offered a variety of food and the beer was very cold. The rooms were very clean. We loved the rain shower in the bathroom. The towels were refreshed each day and the robes were nice to lounge in or wear to the pool as a coverup. The pools was execellent with great service and plenty of loungers and shaded areas. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms Good Food Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: arj_ind
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with very good location very near to Taksim Square. Staff at hotel was extremely helpful and cheerful. The although looked small from outside but was fairly big. One must try their spa with massage its a bliss. The breakfast was very very good great choices. We were a group of more than 50 travelling together hence the service rendered was also special.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisa c
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel whilst doing a private tour around Turkey. This was a lovely 5 star hotel great standard of accommodation and wonderful facilities. I really can not find thought with this hotel clean comfortable and was exactly what I expected from a 5 start luxury hotel. However the only thing is we usually like to stay in smaller accommodation of a lower grade as we like to get that small and friendly atmosphere where you dont feel like just another number. However if your are looking for 5 start luxury and quality i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, beautiful pool”
Reviews.Author: travelread
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the club level for 3 nights in September and were very happy with our stay. We arrived after a long flight and missing one suitcase; we were whisked up to the club level for check in and advised to have a drink/snack upon arrival as the evening service was due to end in 20 minutes. The woman at check in spent some time on the phone tracking our suitcase and notified staff the next day - when we arrived back from sightseeing, another man saw us looking around a bit and said, 'are you looking for a suitcase? I've just put it in your room!'. The room was spacious, comfortable, and a pleasure to return to. The pool area is beautiful. There were lots of kids playing in the pool while we were there. The club room food was interesting, delicious, plentiful, and displayed beautifully. The club room itself was nice but does not have a Bosphorus view. The staff was helpful and attentive. The only negative I can think of was that the wifi was occasionally not working (and was only available for free in the club room). We used public transportation to get to the tourist sights and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “5-star quality”
Reviews.Author: TravelProNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 night in late August. What I liked: Centrally located and very convenient for accessing anywhere on foot and tram.My name on TV screen in a room for welcoming arrival, Modern and elegant feeling overall, professional and courtous staff, clean and spacious room, spacious bathroom with nice amenity, private elevator for club floor, great pool in a wonderful setting in the middle of big city. What I didn't like: None. Loved this hotel. Very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected, Will Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Istanbul for a couple of nights while in Istanbul on business, and was extremely satisfied with the experience. The staff were friendly and helpful, the location puts plenty of restaurants, coffee shops (incl Starbucks), other shops, clubs, ... within walking distance, and the room was certainly up to Hyatt's high standards. Though I did not use the pool nor the spa, both seemed to be popular and enjoyed by other patrons. The fitness center is adequate, but a bit cramped. I did not experience overcrowding, but for the size of the hotel, I imagine there are times when the limited spaces around equipement and free weights makes it unpleasant to try to be squeezing in a workout. Do, however, be prepared for a hefty bill at this property. Colleagues in Istanbul tell me that there are not nearly enough business hotels to meet demand at peak times, so the prices are high (similar to Paris, London, and New York). And, like Paris, London, and New York, Istanbul is a great city and definitely worth visiting many times. I most likely go back to the Grand Hyatt on my next return visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jstick
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great location. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at all levels”
Reviews.Author: Aktham55
Reviews.Content: I travel at least twice a month and stay at first class hotels all around the World. This is one of the best hotels I've ever seen. I stayed there for eleven nights and couldn't find any single remark to say: Excellent hotel, large rooms, Excellent staff, friendly, professional and so helpful. and Excellent food....Wow May be as all others say, the hotel location is not the best. I have to say to the hotel Management: Chapeau......

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: dgely
Reviews.Content: I agree the last review that this is not the best location. We stayed here in August. We originally booked the Hyatt for 4 nights and after the 1st night we switched to the Four Seasons. The room rate for the hotel was a good price but once you were in the hotel the food and drinks were very expensive and on par with the Four Seasons. The lobby and the common areas of the hotel were impressive. They were updated, clean and very pretty. The pool was also very nice but there were not enough seating at the end of the day. The rooms were okay. They were clean and the bed was very comfortable. The negative part were the rooms were a dated and bland. The main reason why we switched hotels is because we did not like the location. The first night we walked to Taskim Square for dinner. It was crowded, a bit dirty and there weren't any nice restaurants and stores. We became aware that when we needed to go out to dinner we were going to have to take taxis to leave the area. It may have been safe but it did not feel like the best area to be in. It is not a pretty area of the Istanbul. I recommend either staying in the Old City a boutique hotel or on the Bosphourus.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended, Location Is Not The Best”
Reviews.Author: wong561hb
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 days / 2 nights at the GH in Istanbul's Taksim Sq. If you appreciate and enjoy the luxury and amenities afforded by the more well known "chain" hotels around the world, then this is a solid hotel option when visiting Istanbul. Note that Taksim Sq. is probably a bit less "happening" than Sultanahmet, but, if you're willing to take a cab or the train in to Sultanahmet to do your sight-seeing, don't miss out on the opportunity to stay here. Apart from the Four Seasons in Sultanahmet, all other 5 star hotels are in the Taksim Sq area, so true luxury is not readily available in the Sultanahmet area. The staff was courteous, the service at the pool bar was solid and dinner at the Italian restaurant was excellent. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with most comfortable spacious rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Utku67
Reviews.Content: Apart from too high parking charges, an relatively average kitchen, this is generally a very good hotel. It us a pity that its kitchens are not upto the level that Hyatt brand represnts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hannaudeh
Reviews.Content: First time in the grand hyatt after a few times in the park hyatt I really liked this hotel the rooms r big nice clean not as big and nice as the park hyatt but I liked it better more practical and closer and more easier mood try it u will not regret it

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: worldsailors
Reviews.Content: We booked a club level room, very well worth it. We had a beautiful view of the city from our room as well as access to the club lounge. The daily breakfast in the lounge was spectacular along with the daily cocktail hour with snacks in the evening. We were within easy walking distance of numerous restaurants and able to walk around the a variety of attractions. The staff were all very helpful and extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: peter2NewYork
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here for three nights and I would stay here again gladly. Beautiful architecture, great pool, incredible breakfasts, lovely room and a great helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, location not the best”
Reviews.Author: SusanWellington
Reviews.Content: This was a conference venue for a group of about 100 from around the world. The hotel was great. I upgraded to a club room, which gave breakfast, free wifi and drinks and nibbles in the afternoon. I thought it was worth the extra money. You also get a better room, I think. The bed was super comfy, great sheets, phenomenal pillows. It is close to Taksim sq so can catch the funicular and a tram down to the old city, or to the boat terminals. There are also lots of restaurants around the sq. The lunch buffet at the hotel was part of our conference and was to die for. Lots of food, all high quality. The only problem is if you are a woman travelling alone, the short walk around can be more than uncomfortable. I was approached many times and the turkish men didn't seem to want to leave me alone. Another issue was a cab driver who stole 100 TL from me..a long story but be careful since I learned that many are not honest.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific business hotel, rooms a little dated”
Reviews.Author: businss_travell3r
Reviews.Content: This hotel scores high from a pretty tough critic because it hits all the basic criteria and gives something extra. The overall experience at this hotel is superior. Staff (outside of the business centre, where the temperature drops several degrees) are friendly and helpful. The layout of the rooms, with the partially open plan bathroom, is wonderful and feels spacious. Unfortunately it also feels rather dated upon closer inspection and could do with a little updating. Room service food is great (but isn't all food in Istanbul?) and location is right in the heart of the city and a short taxi ride away from most places of interest. Would certainly recommend to business and leisure travellers alike - although business travellers should not expect more than a one-computer business centre with a very slow printer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Property and Attentive, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: AntonRaphaelMengs
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for accommodations upon the completion of a Seabourn cruise ending in Istanbul. We had 14 rooms for a couples trip that was a social event with friends. It met all expectations for a first class international hotel and complimented the quality of the seven day cruise. It's a very attractive property with spacious rooms and attractive public spaces, including the lobby, restaurant (indoor and outdoor), bar and pool. There is a travel agent on site for local travel arrangements, a concierge and conveniently located ATM. The hotel staff was friendly and a testament to Hyatt's international standards. I booked direct with the hotel and was entirely satisfied with the responsiveness of the group booking department. The group rate was better than the Intercontinental and Ritz Carlton across the street The breakfast service was diverse and creative and the setting in August outdoors in the morning was a great start to the day. Istanbul itself was an unexpected pleasure as Turkey has worked very hard to make itself into a updated destination travel location and it is doing a good job. Great pool to relax.

Reviews.Title: “perfect accomodation, but taking a taxi can be risky business ...”
Reviews.Author: BogdanGabriel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is absolutely superb! The rooms are very spacious, the bathroom is amazing, the outside pool looks awesome as well and breakfast is very diverse, with both oriental and international cuisine. We came to Istanbul just to watch a football game between the local Besiktas and Steaua Bucharest, and we had to take taxis to move around Istanbul. However, beware of taxi (taksi) drivers. Make sure you stay on the back seat and wear a seatbelt. Turkish taxi drivers consider themselves Formula 1 drivers, so you can imagine the thrill. During a 15 minutes ride, we almost hit 5 cars...

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly helpful and patient staff”
Reviews.Author: MSG55
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here three times previously this year I can say I have not been disappointed. The staff are always helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Large, well-kept property in busy area”
Reviews.Author: PhDTigress
Reviews.Content: This large, very Western hotel was immaculate and well appointed. The rooms were very spacious and well appointed and the bathrooms were especially nice. The quality of the furniture and linens was high. The staff was courteous and professional, and the buffet breakfast featured a wide variety of tasty items. The most attractive feature was the pool -- one of the most beautiful I've ever swum in. I would have preferred a smaller, more Turkish hotel in the old city, but for comfort and convenience the Grand Hyatt was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel both for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: VitaliyS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during business trip to Istanbul. Hotel is very conveniently located in Taksim - the area where majority of top class hotels are. The Dolmabahce palace is only 10 min away by foot (way back will be longer as hotel situated on the hill and you have to climb) and from there you can easily take tram which in 15-20 min will bring you to St, Sophia and Blue Mosque. Because of its location on the high hill if you are lucky (like I was) and have room on one of the upper floors facing the sea you will have beautiful view of Bosphorus. The rooms is very big in size (which is really usual for Hyatt hotels) with huge bathroom, featuring both bathtub and walk in shower. All standard amenities of upscale hotel are present (bathrobe, slippers, big LCD, etc), the bed quality is very good. Breakfast is very good, with wide variety and high quality of products, also tried lunch and dinner - quality of food was always very high. The public areas are very nice and spotless clean, the Library - is wonderful, and the service is second to none. Hotel has big nice outdoor swimming pool, which unfortunately was closed in Feb (operates only in summer). Business facilities are very good - there are a lot of meeting rooms in different parts of the hotel. Probably the only 2 minor complaints are the absence of indoor pool - I think that luxury hotel in Istanbul should have indoor pool, moreover that the hotel is quite big and there is enough space for it; and paid Internet in the room - which I personally found really strange taking into account the room price, but which unfortunately is the case for many luxury hotels. Despite these minor things, the hotel is really very good and can be recommended for both leisure and business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonianGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night, but it was really excellent. The pool was great. The service was excellent as well. You won't be disappointed. Everyone who works there tries really hard to make sure you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!”
Reviews.Author: TastyTraveller1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights and couldn't be more impressed with the hotel. The 2 ladies staffing the club floor concierge desk were extremely helpful and met our every request. Breakfast was absolutely fantastic on the club level, in fact so good we didn't even venture downstairs to the main dinning area for eggs. The evening drinks and canapÃ©s were also excellent and the staff kept the champagne flowing. The room (847) must have one of the best views in the hotel, overlooking the city and the Bosporus, waking up in the morning was a real pleasure. The room was large, as was the bathroom, and housekeeping did a great job always keeping the room tidy and clean... they even straightened out my wife's large shoe collection everyday! The pool area is great to relax and unwind. Even though the hotel was full we always managed to find sun loungers available and on one afternoon even though they were all full the staff managed to find to more and make space for us. We dined at Spazio one evening, the hotels Italian, and it was great. Highly recommended if you don't feel like venturing out after a full day sightseeing. One tip when venturing out, get a taxi from the hotel as they are less inclined to rip you off... and trust me, the taxi drivers are extremely adept at ripping you off! We cannot thank the Hyatt enough for making our mini break so wonderful! I highly recommend staying here for either business or leisure. And be sure to try the Gaia spa onsite, the Hammam and massage were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: zadkine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights and was very pleased with the location, the staff, the cleanliness of my room, everything. But I must comment on the food. It was outstanding, both room service and in the restaurant. I don't know why the Hyatt doesn't rank higher in the ratings, when I return to Istanbul this is where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ( location + every thing )”
Reviews.Author: Aisha A
Reviews.Content: I realy like and adore this hotel every thing was super room - facilities - bathroom - service -location just next to takseem squair - breakfast - atomspher - every thing nothing bad at all i really would like to return her again .let me tell you some feature : 1- the toilet has tub + shower + banigo + 3 rob and towels 2- 4 botels of water serve every day for free 3- tea and cofee maker with tea and suger and cofee for free every day supply 4- very clean and charm 5- big room and huge tolit 6- the breakfast was delicous and fresh 7- the spa was great 8- the location is the best 9- see the photo and judge

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - definitely five stars!!”
Reviews.Author: mjj11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in a room on the Club Floor which included breakfast. Everything about the hotel was great from check in to accommodating our requests. The breakfasts were excellent and the friendliness of service made the stay memorable. We would recommend the Club Floor as there are daily drinks and canapÃ©s in the Club Lounge from 6 - 8pm free of charge. Overall a very good hotel and we would definitely stay here again when in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “I would go again to Istanbul just to stay a couple of days in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mtza3
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful! Good location (10 minutes walk to Taksim are). The room is big, nice with big bed, desk and some kind of bed where you can put you coffee, laptop etc and lay down and work at the same time. The bathroom is great ( tub + shower) big, beautiful. If you read the other review I wrote about other hotels you saw that I generally have a problem with towels. The towels at Hyatt are great :) About breakfast: 6 types of fresh juice; fruits; cheese; eggs; bacon etc. all great; Service: great The terrace is a very romantic place to stay in the evening. This hotel is the top of my list so far. In general I think everyone has the right to his own unsatisfaction :))). But the reviews I have read with poor or terrible are not fair! This hotel is GREAT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of Istanbul's finest”
Reviews.Author: Nana_JP
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, comfortable, well located with one of the best breakfast buffets I've ever had. While it is not very convenient to the best tourist sites at Sultanahmet, the public transport is close and excellent so it is not a negative. The area is loaded with great little places to eat if you don't want to travel far from the hotel. If you need to be in the vicinity for business reasons, this is a great place to hang your hat.

Reviews.Title: “In general, happy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: Tango-Xpress
Reviews.Content: Before the hardworking week in the small city in middle Anatolia, decided to have a relaxing day in Istanbul. As Hyatt GP Diamond I got upgrade to the Club Floor room. It was pretty nice with big bathroom and the beds were quite comfortable too, despite being perhaps a bit dated in current standards. What I did not like however, was that the welcome amenity did not originally include a drink, as it has to be, per rules. However, they sent a bottle of wine - the same which they have up in the Club - and which unfortunately is completely undrinkable. One of the worst I have tasted in many years. I wonder if the one who had ordered it has ever tasted it. The food in the Club was pretty good however, in particular I liked the sweet cherries :) The swimming pool is great to refresh up in the end of the day. Location is within walking distance from Taksim Square, where you can get with airport shuttle :) But price-wise - I think they ask too much for what they provide.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel, Fabulous Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gailedie
Reviews.Content: Our 5 day stay was enhanced by the very comfortable mattresses and pillows, plenty of table space to spread out on, lovely, large bathrooms, courteous and knowledgeable concierge services, and fabulous breakfast buffets. There is also a large, true fitness center with excellent equipment and great natural light. The first floor bar is really a library, warm and elegant. I debated staying at a smaller hotel with more local atmosphere and character, but was very glad I chose this Hyatt. It is within walking distance of some very good restaurants and of Taksim Square and its adjacent shopping street which was a terrific two hour stroll the day of our arrival from the States. If you have never been to Istanbul, this hotel will make your initiation to the city easy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Unplesant service by club floor desk”
Reviews.Author: eduarmerhyneto
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights end of march 2011. Decided for club floor to have better service and unfotunatelly was surprised by the unpleasent, rude and very unprofessional service from Mr. Mehmet on the 8th floor's desk. Needed assistence to buy ferry ticket to my sister that was also in the hotel with her family and when asked help from The desk this guy simply pointed me the computer in the desk next to his and said I should do it from there, but The computer was beiing used for a long time from another guest that didn't seem to intend going away. Ask him if he could help us once the website from ferry company was not working to pay with credit card in english and we didn't speak Turkish to buy from the phone he looked as we were disturbing his internet surfing time. I said I would go downstairs for help, then he moved to help us in a very bad mood. The chek out was the same kind. It's unbelievable that Hyatt keep such service Personel in their Hotels specially on club floors. Concierge service for city informations was also bad. Bad experience! Never go back and I am Hyatt frequent guest! Stayed room 850 from march 30 to april 3. Eduar from Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gw76
Reviews.Content: 3 day trip, impressive building from outside. A little surprised by the degree of airport style security at the hotel door. Helpful and efficient check-in. Plush opulent surroundings. Grand pillars and glas mezzanine level. Lots of staff around. Outdoor areas less used as off season. Looks nice in the gradens terraces and pool areas. Bedrooms bright nuetral and modern. Only downside ( on my floor - level5) was it was a smoking floor and I didnt like the smell. Noisy next to lift ( rm 528) Very expensive in hotel for food and drink. Lots of options for eating though. We enjoyed the buffet evening meal, though again, expensive. Grill section for freshly produced kebabs. Large bur very firm beds. Soft pillows.Bathroom has odd openable shutter between bath and main room. Spotlessly clean throughout and merits 4/5 * rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, marked by superb service and a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: StevenMiller77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Business and some sightseeing activities in March and was extremely impressed. The standard of service was extremely high with all parts of the hotel incredibly welcoming and efficient. The hotel is close to Taksim Square which is not a particularly grand square but leads to a fantastic shopping boulevarde packed with cafes, restaurants and, even at 10pm on a Monday evening, people! A short, but steep, downhill walk will find you at the Dolmabahce Palace and the extremely convenient tram to the Sultanhamet area, I recommend taking this form of transport rather than taxi! Breakfast and room service in the hotel are both outstanding, rooms are large and very comfortable with excellent bathrooms. My only misgiving is the extremely patchy internet connection but if you are here for leisure stay away from the laptop and enjoy everything that the wonderful city of Istanbul has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: oatstrawtea
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while accompanying my father on a business trip. The Hyatt is everything that you would expect it to be accommodating, luxurious and comfortable. The breakfast options here were unbelievable and the location is excellent. The gym facility was wonderful and I appreciated that they had a separate stretching room with yoga mats and core equipment, they also offer regular yoga classes. I took advantage of the spa, the salt scrub and massage was amazing and I would recommend it. I think that for the type of trip I was on or for business purposes it was ideal, however, typically I prefer more boutique style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Tiresia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is marvellous, located in a zone very useful for business and tourism. The rooms are lovely and the atmosphere is really good. The service is perfect and the people are really professional and kind. Unfortunately I had no time to live totally the experience in the hotel, because I had a lot of meetings outside, but I suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lewes77
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. The Hyatt in Istanbul lives up to its reputation and status. Rooms are large, clean and comfortable, with a very welcoming 'rain' shower. Breakfast is of a very high standard, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel is one of comfort. My only is gripe is that I had problems with the internet connection (but again this could have been my computer). Oh and there is no indoor pool - lovely spa area though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with great views of the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: CBeam
Reviews.Content: Traveling on Business, but added several days to trip to tour Istanbul. The Grand Club floor had a conference room that could be booked and was useful for a meeting place. Staff was very helpful. The hotel is near Taskim Square which is away from the historic areas of the Istanbul. There is a funicular nearby that connects to the trolley line that runs into the historic part of City or the ferries that connect to the Asia side of the City. Would definitely stay here again and would recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and the food is brilliant”
Reviews.Author: radicalseven
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit to Istanbul and the Grand Hyatt is an excellent place as a base. It's easy to get around the city on the tram, and the hotel is good to come back to. We loved the food- breakfast, dinner and room service- the Turkish dishes including the sweets were fabulous. Service was attentive and helpful. Loved the bathroom with a great shower in particular. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hyatt was great!”
Reviews.Author: Poveshom
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt was a real pleasure to come back to each day during our trip to Istanbul. A real oasis from the bustling, busy city, the hotel has truly exceptional service, nice-sized, elegantly decorated rooms & bathrooms, as well as a plentiful breakfast. I didn't see any downsides at all, actually, and enthusiastically recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... but with some flaws”
Reviews.Author: ibreak4coffee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in November 2010, and had I written this review on day one or two, it might have been a five star review. However, on the third night of our stay my wife was bitten by something while we were sleeping - maybe a spider, not sure what it was but it hurt and she couldn't sleep afterwards - but the front desk was pretty rude when we requested to change rooms. We did end up changing in the end but not without a hassle and we would have preferred to have been treated with more respect when we made the request (especially as I'm a frequent Hyatt guest). First the pros - this is a pretty nice hotel up to most Grand Hyatt standards. Loved the location close to Taksim Square and Istiklal Caddesi (a 5 minute walk) - for my money its much better to stay in this area and enjoy the great restaurants and bars than in Sultanahmet. The metro is right next door as well which makes moving around the city very convenient. Breakfast was very good and the staff were extremely friendly and professional every morning. The bar is nice as well on the mezzanine with some good Turkish wine selections. In the room, the bathroom was incredibly nice and spacious - loved the rain shower. They provide free water twice a day as well. Overall, the room is spacious and no major complaints. The cons - the rooms are getting a bit dated. No flat screen TV, an older one that I used to have ten years ago. The bed was hard as a rock as well and looked worn. As mentioned, the front desk staff can be rude. One other thing I didn't like - after paying $250 a night for a room, I don't think the hotel should nickel and dime their guests by charging 1TL to mail postcards (with stamps already on them). Overall I cant say I would recommend or not recommend the hotel. The pros outweigh the cons, but there are plenty of other properties right next door - Intercontinental, Hilton, Ritz Carlton, W Hotel, Swisshotel - so I might try one of those next time I visit Istanbul. But I would also definitely return here if the rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Attention :Mr. Jan Peter van der Ree,General Manager of Grand Hyatt Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DubaiSara
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was very beautiful and historical place . Stayed at Grand Hyatt Istanbul for 6 nights in November 2010 . Front Office Staff was very RUDE and USELESS . Our travel agency booked and we paid our hotel accomodation on Sept . 2010. requested for an early check in and connecting rooms . I even called the hotel front office 2 days prior to our arrival to confirm our request of interconnecting room . Arrived Istanbul at early morning as stated on our reservation confirmation . To horror of all horrors .. after a whole night of travel .First , Mr. Murat has told us that our reservation was cancelled by our travel agency . No explanation at all .Got to call our Travel agency overseas many times . My husband told them we got a voucher and reservation confirmation No. 45160645. We paid our hotel accomodation on Sept . 2010. A month and a half before our arrival to Istanbul . Why does Mr. Murat doesn't focused on the name indicated in the hotel voucher and the reservation confirmation . No rooms available for us even we got a voucher and a Grand Hyatt confirmation of reservation with a request of interconnecting room . We understood that the hotel is fully booked and normal check in time was 14;00 p.m but what we were requesting was a connecting room because I have my children with me . I think all mothers would do the same . Front office Staff was offering a room ,3 rooms apart from each other . We are all exhausted for travelling the whole night and waited for our room till 14:00 p.m. Only one room was available . Very distressing . Front Office Staff was very useless, kept on blaming our travel agency eventhough we kept on telling that we have Grand Hyatt Istanbul confirmation number .We sounded like a broken discarded CD. They kept on confusing us by saying that our reservation in another name was cancelled though it was very crystal clear that the name indicated in our hotel voucher and the Grand Hyatt confirmation No. 45160645 was very valid .The front office Mr. Murat was very unreasonable and twisting everything .No hospitality or kind gesture at all . We even requested for a room besides each other if no connecting room available. Being a helpless tourist family in Istanbul ,One of my son was already sleeping in the sofa and my 5 year old daughter was too sleepy , we agreed as family of 5 to be squeezed in 1 room with 4 big suitcases in the 7th floor .Waiting again for another room far away as it was was being prepared . Five minutes promised waiting becomes. another hours . I kept on calling our travel agency in Dubai and my phone bill amounted equal to a one night stay . The drama kept on going as the Front Office Manager entered the scene as I requested to speak to the GM of the Hotel. . F. O. Manager kept on blaming us and our travel Agency . His voice was very loud in the telephone . I explained to him that since September 2010 we paid our hotel and I even called Grand Hyatt prior to our arrival . I told him that we have reservation No. 45160645 from Grand Hyatt Istanbul . He told me that other guest have confirmation for interconneting room before they arrived Istanbul .I asked him how the other guest avail the interconnecting room confirmation . How come they havent told me when I called the front office prior to our arrival . I even aked how the other customers avail of interconnecting room confirmation . His answer was twisted again . Kept blaming our travel agency and told me that If I have a confirmation of interconnecting room they will upgrade us to a suite . Making the matter worse than solving it . I told the Front Office Manager , Mr. Furqan that our travel agency is one of the biggest and reliable in Dubai but if we need to take legal action.. we will do so . Suddenly with a speed faster than lightning and Superman , He offered us 2 room besides each other on the 6th floor . 2 rooms besides each other suddenly dropped from the sky . What a great way to start our holiday ... our first tour was cancelled because of Grand Hyatt front office staff . Front Office Staff focused on blaming instead solving the issue . They made the guest feel unwelcome , helpless and hopeless . Grand Hyatt Istanbul F and B Department were EXCELLENT . Thay are exceptional in many ways . Staff at the Agora Buffet breakfast are attentive and cheerful . Wide selection of food and the Simit Local bread was delicious .We dined for 5 nights through Room Service . Staff of Room Service and their Chefs were exceptional and the gave us the finest in dining . The king prawns , tomato spaghetti , yogurtlu kofte , spring chicken ,urfa kebab ,beef burger ,cheesecake are savory . F and B Department made our stay in Istanbul worthy . Housekeeping Staff always kept our room fresh and neat . They always make sure our simple request were granted like ironing board and the iron . The lady answering the phone for HK was courteous. Warmest Thanks to the all the Staff of Grand Hyatt Istanbul excluding the Front Office and Concierge . I hope . Mr. Jan Peter van der Ree,General Manager of Grand Hyatt Istanbul understood the situation we 've been through . Kindly do the needful .Please give proper training of Customer Service to all your Front Office Staff and Concierge.They must learn to respect the guest and to deal with courtesy . This will be our first and last stay in any Hyatt Hotel. BITA Tours toured us for four days . Amazing Istanbul. Visited Blue Mosque , Topkapi Palace Hagia Sophia , Dolmabahce Palace , Bhosporus Cruise , Spice Bazaar and Princes' Island . From Grand Hyatt we walked several times to Istiklal Cadessi . The locals were mostly nice people. Beautiful Istanbul . So rich in history and a very interesting place to visit Their carpets , textiles , ceramics and jewellery are the best in the world. Warmest Thanks to the beautiful and kind people of Istanbul . We will be back again

Reviews.Title: “Overrated & Dull!?”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad_KUW
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is below average when it comes to five star hotels. Beds are very old and deformed from prolonged use. Especially with price we paid for this hotel. Hotel in general is dull and lacks spirit. I would never consider it again nor would i recommend it to a friend. I presume that any other five star hotel would definitely be better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not worth the high price”
Reviews.Author: chickytava
Reviews.Content: I attended a week-long conference at the Grand Hyatt in Taksim in late October 2010. Overall, the location was great (walking distance to Istaklal Street and close to the metro and tram), the food (at the conference and during breakfast & lunch) was excellent, and the room was extremely clean. However, nothing was particularly exceptional, and there were some service flaws, leading me to conclude that this is a rather average 5-star hotel with a heavy price tag. In regards to service issues, they put me in a smoking room initially, although my office had reserved all non-smoking rooms. Then, I never received a wake-up call the first morning I was there, and the next morning, they called an hour too early. Although apologetic on all fronts, it still didn't change the fact that there were a few screw-ups. Also, during meals, the waiters continuously interrupted our table discussions to try to take away dishes that were clearly still being consumed. It became a running joke at the conference... hold your plate and fork so they don't grab them when you turn your head! Also, there is no wi-fi, and the internet costs 3 euro per hour, and you have to use the 60 minutes at one sitting -- you can't check your email for 10 minutes and then freeze the timer. Unfortunately, it's all or nothing. Turned out to be very expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recently upgraded to Grand Hyatt from Regency Hyatt this hotel has a lot to offer to all visitors.”
Reviews.Author: mlelsc
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and extremely helpful. Food excellent throughout the hotel. Bedrooms are very comfortable with good facilities if a tad old fashioned. Swimming pool and fitness centre excellent. Good views over the city from this hotel and the lounges are extremely relaxing throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: db1337
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on good experiences with the Andaz Hyatt brand. The hotel has a nice lobby and atmosphere, and there are staff around to assist... service was good to excellent, especially in the restaurant. Overall I can't say I liked Istanbul or Turkey much, as soon as you get into the airport the billing commences. Buy your little sticker for your passport for 45 euros, no checking or anything involved, just gouge you because they can. This type of thing extends to the taxi drivers... 3 out of 5 attempted to scam me, and one did nail me when I dropped my guard (did a bill switch on me). The cab drivers will try to take you an out of the way route, or run without the meter on, or start the meter high. So be aware, ask your hotel what the expected cab fare will be before going to your location. Ask the cab driver for the expected fare before getting in. Watch the meter at all times. The bill switch scam works when you give them a large bill for change, if you drop your attention, say fussing with a wallet or purse, they will switch the bill and wave a small bill in your face like you got the currency wrong. I fell for one of those after a long day walking around. Back to the Hyatt, in-room you're going to be paying about $15/night for internet, anything from the minibar will be very expensive (about $9.00 for a can of Coke for instance). I had to send some faxes, and the charge per page worked out to about six euro. So a ten page fax will run you about $80.00. If you're stuck and need to fax it, they have you nailed. Buffet breakfast I think ran to about $40 which is pretty expensive for an omlette and sides. I hate this feeling of being nailed and of being gouged, but that was the entire experience of Istanbul. I don't think the Taksim square location is anything great, the few business hotels side by side there are nestled in an ugly area. The old town of Constantinople/Byzantium/Istanbul was much nicer by comparison. I followed a recommendation from this site to stay on the Taksim side and that I think was really not for me, maybe if you are going to hang out in bars every night. The rooms are adequate in this hotel and comfortable, I found them to be quiet. The food was also adequate, nothing special, but not bad. If you have to go for business and your company is paying for everything, well I guess that is what this hotel is for. For a tourist, you probably have better choices. The sights of the old town are magnificent and it is maybe worth a visit for them, but overall with all the charges and scams I would say pass on visiting Turkey and go somewhere else. Also any tourist areas were really jam packed, so you are elbow to elbow with people in some areas to the point of being claustrophobic. There is no concept of queuing in Turkey either. If you are slow to move forward someone will step into your spot, if you pause at all you are roadkill. Even if you defend your zone trying to move forward people will try to advance from behind you and squeeze in front of you anyway. Overall I just don't need any of this on a trip meant to be fulfilling.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful oasis in a very hectic city”
Reviews.Author: abotel
Reviews.Content: Very well located modern hotel with spacious,nicely furnished rooms & bathrooms.Service & staff very helpful & friendly. Definite "american" feel to the hotel but this was actually nice after considerable sightseeing in a a very foreign environment. Turkish themed restaurant much better than the Italian though outdoor ambience of the later is great. Pool area is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, but not the best one in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Vielflieger_44
Reviews.Content: The rooms are ok, but not very spacious though. Only the club floor rooms have some extra amenities, but the lounge there is good. What upsets me in this hotel is the service of the staff. Especially at the reception, they're unpolite and sometimes rude. Check-in and check-out takes way too long. Staff is not very helpful at all if you have a special request.....well forget it. Restaurant staff is much better. Not quite the standard you'd expect. The pool is not very big by the way, if you plan to go for a swim.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ethanmcc
Reviews.Content: What a great choice for our honeymoon! We were given a room with an amazing view of the bosphorous, the general manager left a handwritten note, wine, fruit and roses in our room...A++. Also, you can get a hamaam treatment (turkish bath) with your spouse and then couples massage at the spa in the hotel. The pool is a perfect retreat after a day of sightseeing. Breakfast is very nice, but very pricey. Lots of alternatives near by if you walk to Taksim square (a four minute walk) and head down Istiklal Caddesi, which is the most happening street in Istanbul. Great location + great service = great honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “You will love it!”
Reviews.Author: JB88fml
Reviews.Content: This really is a great hotel. The rooms are large and comfortable. The bathrooms very lux. I was there for a week on a business trip and I didn't want to leave. The staff is very freindly the service is excellent. There are a few restaurants in the hotel and the food everywhere was great. It is, though, pretty expensive, but, you are well pampered. It is also very nice that the metro is just around the corner. It was easy for me to stay in this center city hotel but travel on public transit out to the business center where I was working. It is also easy to travel by public transit to all the major sightseeing venues in the city. Istanbul is a fantastic town to visit and this place is a great place to base yourself.

Reviews.Title: “just what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: 1girlintheworld
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms and well appointed. The staff is helpful and accommodating. The location is a short taxi ride from the Grand Bazaar and other sights. Just be sure to watch the meter like a hawk since Istanbul has some of the worst taxi drivers weâ€™ve ever come across. All in all everything is what you would expect from the price point and from a Grand Hyatt. We would definitely stay again when we visit Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller2255
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my kids for two nights at this hotel. we had three room. Excellent service. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for a first trip to Istambul”
Reviews.Author: pprhh
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istambul during the F1 grand prix and the Grand Hyatt was offering a relatively decent fare compared to other. A piece of the US in Istambul. Efficient and comfortable. Good food, expensive though. You get a better view 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: sankhya
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the first time on vacation, and chose Grand Hyatt because I had some points to use against a couple of nightsâ€”we stayed 10 in total--and because we wanted a really comfy, predictable experience. We opted to pay extra to stay on the Club Level. I have done this in the past at Hyatt (Melbourne, among others), because having the free wi fi and free breakfast makes up for the extra cost. I requested a Bosphorus room several months in advance and we got one (room 951). Because of the Ritz Carlton blocking the view, be forewarned that it is only a partial view, but it is worth it nonetheless. (It was great seeing the weekend fireworks from the room). I also requested a baklava plate which never came (but we werenâ€™t charged for it). As expected, the room was spacious by European standards; pretty much what Iâ€™d expect from a Grand Hyatt club level. A couple of complaints: At the Club Level lounge, the waiters hover incessantly and even get in your face. There is an espresso machine set up for guests to make their own coffee, but the waiters would clearly prefer to do it and give you nasty looks if you want to do it yourself. Taking food or drink from the lounge is forbidden, and this is enforced. Iâ€™m not much of a breakfast person; my preference is to get a decent cup of coffee and take it back to my room while I get ready. Twice I was stopped and told not to do this. I certainly understand that the hotel doesnâ€™t want guests loading up on sandwiches, drinks, or yogurts to take with them during the day, but for heavenâ€™s sake! I just wanted a coffee! The second irritant was that, even on the club level, the hotel charges 1 TL to send a postcard. Câ€™mon! This is a charge for each stamped card! Kind of petty considering what you pay for a room. One of the best things we did was book the â€œjet lagâ€� Turkish hamam at the hotel just hours after flying in from San Francisco. I read a good deal beforehand about hamams in Istanbul; the consensus among many was that they are set up for tourists. That being the case, I thought, why not do this in the hotelâ€”perhaps a little less â€œauthenticâ€�â€”but then we can slide like noodles to room after. Good call. I really felt like the steam and the scrubbing took away all the flight nastiness and indeed helped with the jet lag. Not cheap, though. Security is tight at this property and the pool and the service at the pool is great. Iâ€™m glad we stayed in Taksim instead of the old part of the town; we had some qualms about this, knowing we would be spending most of our time there, but it turned out to be a good call, and I would recommend this to anyone not wanting to be in the thick of tourists. We found some great places to eat with lots of locals on the little side streets of Istiklal, and I donâ€™t think we would have experienced this in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, but you pay a lot.”
Reviews.Author: PerfectStay
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m glad to be able to say that Iâ€™ve had a true 5 stars experience at this hotel. Some resorts think that they can build a fancy building with a big pool and offer you a large and nice room and itâ€™s thereby a 5 star hotel. This hotel has all of that, but what makes it the 5 stars is the service. There were a lot of staff around and they were really helpful true out my stay. The room I had was very big and had large windows overlooking the pool area. There was a large shower and a large tub with blinds you could open to see the TV while relaxing in the tub. Everything with the room was really, really nice with the exception of 3 smaller things. There was no wireless internet (there was a wired connection that was fast, but you had to pay to use it) The bed was a little hard for my likings and even if I never use the TV, the old CRT tube TV kinda pulls down the total impression of the room. These are all small things and in the bigger picture it really doesnâ€™t matter for me. The spa facilities are really nice and the gym is pretty good. The location is fair. You will probably need to take a taxi to get to the most popular sights, but taxi in Istanbul is very cheap. (But alcohol and fuel is not) An ok lunch without alcohol will be about 8 EUR. And a taxi ride of 30 minutes about the same. Distance is not too big, but the traffic can be a pain. The price is pretty stiff, but in my experience you donâ€™t always get what you pay for, but on the Grand Hyatt I got the feeling I did just that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey_GR
Reviews.Content: Istanbul Hyatt offers you what you expect from a Hyatt...great service, clean rooms, exceptional service...This hotel also has excellent spa facilities, great rooms, large beds, many pillows, nice views...great bathroom! Staff was helpful, with adequate English speaking skills. Reception area and concierge very helpful and courteous. Located near Taksim square...walking distance to some sights. Have stayed there 3 times, would stay there again. Recommended for business travellers and for any type of traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly professional service”
Reviews.Author: RenaBeaufort
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I visited Istanbul for a congress. The congress venue as well as the hotel hosting participants was the Hyatt on top of the very central Taksim Sq.. The check-in was quick and as I arrived with an early flight, I needed a nap before venturing in the city. The room was spacious and nicely furnished. I slipped into my bed and slept for some two hours. During the last few years I remark that most hotels have understood the importance of bedding and the Hyatt knows about it. The bedding was relaxing, the bedsheets of good soft cotton quality. Before going out, I passed by the restaurant for a light lunch. A courteous assistant showed me to my table. The self-service buffet selection of well known Turkish plates was what you would expect from a high class restaurant and the broiled meat corner offered delicious meat selections broiled on the spot for you. The congress was well organised but there is a big but and this concerns the lack of wi-fi broadband connection in the congress area. Nowadays, the availability of wi-fi broadband in international congresses is a must, since not only are the presentations live streamed but also participants live comment in their social media. Cutting off a conference from the outside world is deplorable and I cannot understand why the hotels want to sell it as extra. Broadband IS A STAPLE for business venues and business travellers. I think that event organisers should base their venue selection, among other, also on the availability of broadband connection in the event premises, and negotiate special discounted rates for participants staying in the hotel. The hotel charges 3euro per hour of broadband in the guestroom and similar amount in their biz center. For hotels of its standing and rates, the Hyatt should not charge extra for broadband. The following days were uneventful and had a great conference and enjoyed ourselves over lunch or dinner. Finally, I recommend

Reviews.Title: “Bigest disappointment in 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nik0t
Reviews.Content: I had a luck to visit Istanbul in January 2010. It was business trip. We had a groupe of around 20-25 people who stayed in 15 rooms in Hayatt. It was terrible. The attitude of staff is on the level of 3* hotel. I needed to use Internet often and print a lot of copies of different documents. The policy of the hotel is not frlxible for groups and they don't give any discounts or at leats free smiles. But 4 facts were just embarassing: 1. Internet. There is no free wi-fi area at all. Prices for the Internet like this is the only hotel with Internet in Istanbul. 2. I asked to provide a hotel car to meet new arriving group of 4 people in the airport. Decent car with a driver with a card - basic service for any decent hotel. Consierge said - "we don't have such a service". I was shocked then, but asked to find some outsourcing taxi service, and he replied: "We have hundreds of taxi services in Istanbul, do you want me to call all of them?" (NO comments) 3. I needed to buy a basic chair (for the show). Asked on the reception where I can do it. The guy sent me to Istiklal strret. The ones who know this street will laugh at this advise. For the ones who don't know - this street is crowdy touristic street full of caffes, restaurants and clothes shops. To buy a chair there - mission impossible. 4. We were having a drink in the most cosy and nice bar in the hotel - the one with the fire-place. It was Friday or even Satturday night. We were in the "drinking mood" not in terms of aggressive level but in terms of volume of drinks. The waiter came to us at 30 mins past midnight and said that the bar will be closed soon. I tried to talk to him in a nice way, in an angry way but no reaction. He said that we can order a drinks from the room service and drink it at the lobby (not ath the lobby bar but just LOBBY). As a matter of fact one of the guys we were drinking with was the Russian Ballet Start (I mean really well-known and famous). But as I said earlier, the Hayatt policy is "NO EXCEPTIONS". It won't be surprise if I say that those 4 points are unacceptable for 5* hotel !!!! Also the size of hammam is too small for 5*. And no indoor swimming pool. As for the good points: great rooms, amazing view on Bosphorus, basic but quite tasty breakfast. Output: Worse possible value for money. For the same money you can stay in Ciragan Palace Kempinsky 5* with heated outdoor swimming pool, free wi-fi zone at the lobby and atmosphere of Ottoman Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Left with a bad taste due to service and poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: aoghnasmac
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have experiecned, the Grand Hyatt is an OK hotel in as far as public areas and rooms are concerned but is badly let down by the poor service attitude of the front desk staff in particular. Location is Good. Rooms are OK to good. Restaurant for breakfast is poor - sorry I don't expect to stand in a 10 minute queue while one chef tries to do eggs for everyone at breakfast! Pool is OK but pool staff....I think these guys were promoted from front desk due to their positive minded attitude to the customer. The one exception was the 1st floor public area where I received excellent service mid afternoon - salad was good, kebabs great, my glass of water was really nice - hey it cost me 10 Euros for the glass so I had to enjoy it (!!!). Is this typical Hyatt?

Reviews.Title: “Room is the same level as the other Hyatts, but service is amongst the worst”
Reviews.Author: moominbaby
Reviews.Content: We were very tired from a day of traveling and checked into our room around 11 pm. The air conditioner was set to heater and was extremely hot and stuffy. The temperature in the room was about 75 F. We called the front desk and a service person came in about 5 min, which was acceptable. He made some adjustments to the control. While he was still in the room, we told him that the air coming out is still very warm air. He told us to wait 10 minutes and that the air will be cool. After he leave, we waited 20 minutes and the air coming out from the vent is still warm. We called the front desk, asking to have the room changed. They refused our request and said that they'll send someone to take a look. We waited for another 10 min, but saw no one. We called two more times to have a person come. The second person is probably not from housekeeping. His uniform was nicer and spoke better English. His facial expression was impatient, and it gets worse during the short duration that we were with him. We told him about our situation nicely and said that we've waiting for an hour since we checked in to have the heating situation solved. He played with the air conditioning control and told us to wait some more and opened window. It wasn't until that we were firm and said "we need to rest, it's past 12 AM and we've traveled all day, we've already waited for over an hour to have the air conditioning fixed, move us now" that he take us to a new room. He gave us a lot of attitude for requesting to change room. He's wording were impolite, rude, and gave us facial expressions as if we are demanding something outrageous. We've never experiece this type of service in a supposedly five star hotel. The room we switched to was not comparable to the one we had. We had garden view before, the second room look out to another building. The second room's temperature was perfect though. (60-65 F) The guy said he'll drop off keys to the new room later, which he did. However, it wasn't until the second day that we try to open the door to realize that the new key he dropped off did not work. When we came back to the hotel the second day, it took front desk over 20 min. to bring the new key. (Again, the person that came had no smile, and looked annoyed) I read in previous tripadvisor reviews that the service of the hotel is nice. What we experienced was totally contrary. The breakfast was great. They can make egg benedict and french toast upon request. The staff in the restaurants were very courteous and nice. They always smile and greet.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hyatt is situated near Taksim Square, near other larger elegant hotels such as the Intercontinental. It is thus not as convenient as staying in Sultanamet area. However, it is in a quieter neibourhood of Istanbul. Also, it is a pleasant downhill walk of about 10-15 minutes to the tram station, which brings your conveniently to the old area of the city with all the tourist sites, for oly 1 Turkish lira. The hotel itself and the rooms are lovely. Staying on the conciege level is always a plus, as it includes a decent continental breakfast, fruit, coffee and drinks anytime, and a cocktail "hour" every evening with snacks and alcoholic beverages. There were only 2 drawback s we experienced during our stay; one was the "concierge" staff. They were unhelpful, inexperienced and uninformed, bordering on rude. They seemed to be involved on the phone with friends or on the internet. The other was internet access; there is but one free terminal available on the concierge level. Because of the turkish keyboard, I could not log onto my e-mail account. Overall, despite the above, the room was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: almirah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt upon returning to Istanbul after traveling around Turkey for 2 weeks. We had tried to stay in local hotels but we decided to go with something we knew for the last 2 nights just to make sure we had comfortable beds before spending 16 hours getting home. When we arrived at the hotel at almost 9 pm, the place was mobbed. Other customers were trying to change rooms for various reasons and were being told it was not possible since the hotel was 100% booked. I cringed in fear thinking what we would get since we were booked on promotional certificates. Well, what we got was an upgrade to the executive floor, which not only gave us access to the lounge, but also complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails and hor de ouevres. The gentleman who checked us in did apologize profusely, that although the 2 rooms were adjacent, they were not adjoining. No problem. The breakfast were the best we had in Turkey, including not only traditional Turkish items but also more western foods including the best croissants I have ever had other than homemade. The cocktail hour (actually 2 hours I think) had a nice selection of drinks and snacks. The staff was consistantly friendly, with everybody from housekeeping to management saying hello and asking if there was anything we needed. The rooms were extremely nice, with simple but classy furnishings and huge, beautiful bathrooms. Also spotless. I give the Grand Hyatt a ten.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Service All the Way!!!”
Reviews.Author: lesrion99
Reviews.Content: All the staff at this hotel were exceedingly courteous and helpful. I arrived in Istanbul on my birthday only to find that my travel partner was stuck in the States for a couple more days. When they realized I was in a foreign country alone on my birthday they did everything they could to make me feel at home. I went to dinner and when I returned to my room the staff had brought up a birthday cake and card to my room. I was truly touched!! The rooms were great too. I think all or most all either look over the pool or the water. My room looked over the Bosphorus into into. Truly amazing. We took full advantage of all their wonderful amentieis from the sauna to extensive work out room to ample lobby. Would highly recommend this hotel to business travelers and tourists. It's only a 5 minute walk to Taksim Square and Istigal Street -- the main drag in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: misterminute
Reviews.Content: I found the Hyatt in Istanbul to be an excellent hotel. The location is just a short walk to Taksim which is a good area to be a tourist with lots of restaurants, bars, shops and nice small streets. The hotel is modern with large common areas and an outdoor pool (it was open, but it was a bit too cold the weekend we were there). We dined at the hotel restaurant one evening and the food was OK. It's a typical hotel restaurant and you get what you expect. The service is alltogetheris very good. The staff is polite and helpful. There are strict security around the hotel which didn't affect us too much. The rooms are large and modern with large marble bathrooms. The only con is the window shades (or whatever it is) seperating the bedroom from the bathroom. For intimacy issues this is not always very convenient even when closed. The only thing is of course that these american chain hotels doesn't really give you the feel of the area you are visiting. It's quite the standard Hyatt thing and you could be in Tokyo, New York or wherever. For me these kinds of hotels are a bit too safe and alike. Still I would say it's a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: justin44
