Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel overall is nice. The beds are comfortable and the beathrooms are great. Cons: I ordered a smoke free room and its obvious the room has been smoked it - its got that unpleasant smell from prior smoke. Also, they dont offer free internet access. It costs $10 Eur per day and that includes wired access only, if you want wireless you have to go to the business center and purchase a card for an additional $10 Eur per day. Thats a total of $20 Eur per day for service that is free at most other hotels, Thats what make this hotel disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kvitochka
Reviews.Content: Classical and nice hotel, very clean, good location, efficient service and friendly staff, large and delicious breakfast. If you are in Istanbul and would like to try something authentic you should definitely try Hammam. We did couples treatment in Hyatt Gaia SPA and would like to recommend it to everybody: I have never felt myself more clean and relaxed :) Nice experience and again perfect service!

Reviews.Title: “Next time I'm in Istanbul I'm definitely returning to the Grand Hyatt!”
Reviews.Author: IsTaken
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had initially booked for Marmara Taksim. I did A LOT of research on hotels in Istanbul before going there and it consistently seemed like most hotels are rather dated and in need of renovation. My friend was insistent on Marmara and despite my hesitation, I agreed to book with them, didn't want to be a party pooper. We were NOT impressed with Marmara, the staff at concierge looked like they hated their job...the rooms were TINY, the bathroom even smaller...and the seaview room is a joke! Basically you have to twist your neck to catch the corner of the Bosphorus. So we decided to look for another hotel... We decided to switch to Hyatt Regency and thank goodness we did! First of all, the hotel is new and as you can imagine, very modern! The staff were very helpful and even offered to deal with the problems we had with the travel agency and even convinced Marmara to cancel our reservation despite the fact that we had already checked in! We has a few issues with noisy neighbors which they dealt with promptly. The rooms are very spacious, spotlessly clean and very modern....all three points that lack in most European hotels. Breakfast was fantastic! A huge array of western/eastern, hot/cold food. All kinds of cold cuts, fresh fruits and juices, cheese, cakes, pastries, bread and freshly cooked eggs upon request. No hidden extra charges for cappuccino..orange juice...etc. The breakfast room is beautiful as well! Service was excellent...we were always greeted nicely, they helped us plan activities...gave us advice on where to go..and promptly provided us with transport when need be. The location is fantastic as well. The hotel is situated in the heart of Taksim (in Taksim square), a 2 minute walk from Istiklal street and all the main areas and a short taxi ride to Sultanahmet. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but nothing exciting”
Reviews.Author: epapa100
Reviews.Content: Typical 5 star hotel. Impressive lobby, very spacious and well designed rooms, excellent bathroom amenities, room service, sat-tv, you name it, it's all there. But at the same time, it is quite boring - the comparably low room rate (i paid 100 eur/night) is more or less the licence to charge for anything else, like fantasy prices on coke (some 10 times higher than on the street) and especially annoying internet rates (10eur/hour), no wireless in the room (only cable access, which is annoying when you travel with an iphone or similar smart phone). The location is ok, a few minutes walk from Taksim square - but i think i'll take the "risk" of trying a boutique hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury”
Reviews.Author: dancingvoyager
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in Istanbul: The first 3 in the 'old town' (Sultanahmet) and subsequent 3 in Grand Hyatt Istanbul. This turned out well as we saw the historical sights first, such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Grand Bazaar, then headed into the 'newer' part of town (Taksim), which is where the International 5 star hotels are. So Grand Hyatt Istanbul was a great base to explore Istiklal (the main high street), and the fashionable dining/going out areas around it such as 'Tunnel'. We chose a 'Club' room which meant check in was handled on the 8th floor. Having the use of the club lounge felt like an extension of our room and the availability of soft drinks/fruits and knick-knacks throughout the day was a welcome addition! The room was a generous size and clean. The bathroom was as Iâ€™d hoped: well laid out with a separate bath and shower and nice touches such as the L'Occitane products. The bed was great - large and very comfortable. Our experience of housekeeping was very positive: We called for an ironing board and it arrived within minutes. Breakfast in the club lounge was good quality: I particularly recommend the muesli! It's a shame that the pool is outdoors: Seems like a waste in Istanbul. We went in January so there was no chance of enjoying it then! Although I wouldn't call it a spa as there no indoor pool/'water zone', the hotel has a great Hamman and relaxation area: Well worth a visit if you're a fan of taking it easy! We also had a drink in the â€˜Library Barâ€™: Designed in a kind of â€˜cosy grand living roomâ€™ style: Very pleasant for a drink: They were serving seasonal cocktails at the time. Overall a very pleasant experience. Iâ€™d particularly recommend the hotel if youâ€™re staying in Istanbul for more than just a couple of nights, so that you have time to enjoy the hotel as well as Istanbul itself!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, easy base for enjoying Istanbul's many treasures.”
Reviews.Author: Expat_wife
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel not as close to the old town area as we would have liked, we had a very comfortable stay here during our week in Istanbul and would go back again. It has recently been upgraded to a Grand Hyatt. The staff was warm, friendly and very helpful with sightseeing tips. The rooms are big and what you expect from a Hyatt. Some of the rooms have views of the Bosphorus, others overlook the pool area. We enjoyed the Turkish breakfast buffet in the mornings. It's pricey but was generous enough that we were able to skip lunch most days. The pool area looked very inviting and would be nice during warmer weather. If you have time, the spa is a very nice place to relax after a long day sightseeing. I enjoyed the facial very much. There are two restaurants in the hotel, both are good. There are plenty of restaurants in the Taksim area as well for dinner. The Hyatt is close to Taksim Square so you will need to find transportation across the water to the old town area to see all the main sites (Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, etc). We took taxis to go to Sultanmahet (about 20 TL each way) every day. We walked to old town one time across the bridge but it was a long walk and not very relaxing with cars speeding past. We were in Istanbul for the week of New Year's and experienced different weather conditions almost every day. It was sunny and 16C a couple of days, but would dip down to freezing at night. Other days we had heavy rain and one night even had some light snow. It was quite windy as well. I recommend bringing lots of layers and a good coat. We skipped the Bosphorus cruise because the water looked quite rough. Based on the recommendation of the Hyatt concierge, we opted to take the overnight tour to see the cave dwellings in Cappadocia (a World Heritage Site). It was the highlight of our trip and highly recommended! We booked the tour through the Hyatt and it was all inclusive (airfare, hotel, meals, private guide and private car with driver for two days) for about 300 TL for 4 people. It was well worth it! The 4th century cave dwellings and churches were amazing as were the bizarre rock formations throughout this area. It was incredible to see. The guide was fantastic and took time to show us some of the local life such as how the village women bake their bread in an outdoor communal oven. We had hot bread to take with us as a snack and it was delicious. It was quite cold with some snow and ice on the ground. The hotel in Uchisar was tucked up against the cliff but was not actually a "cave hotel" as some of the hotels in the area are. If this is important to you, specify at the time of booking. The hotel was clean but not luxurious in any way but it was fine for one night. Note: the Hyatt allowed us to check out of our rooms for one night (storing our luggage) so we did not have to pay for the night we were gone. Also, we booked a guide to see the main sights in Istanbul one day and found that you skip the long lines at the ticket offices when you have a guide. A nice perk if you are short on time. Don't miss the underground Cisterns. Beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ZAK12003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency for four nights on business. The hotel is located near Taxim square which is a lively part of Istanbul but itâ€™s not near all the historical sites. The room was average. It had all the basics but for a Hyatt Regency you would expect a much more updated room. The room and bathroom were clean. I had brunch at their Italian restaurant and the spread that was laid out was spectacular. You have to try their Sunday brunch if you are there. They have a swimming pool but itâ€™s located outside and itâ€™s not heated. Didnâ€™t make sense for a place like Istanbul where it isnâ€™t hot year round. There spa was nice but the steam room was not working while I was there. Ok hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “unbeleivable deception”
Reviews.Author: Ucko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend a romantic weekend in Istanbul, in our home city and as the days were very limited, did not want to risk any disappointment and chose Hyatt Regency Istanbul as we were sure everything would be perfect in return of the high rates we were to pay. We could not have been more wrong: it's true, the location of the hotel is perfect, the view of Bosphorus (though only from a limited number of rooms) is mesmerizing, the room is spacious, the spa is excellent.... but all the rest is just deceiving.... Maybe if our expectations were not so high, we would not be so much deceived but they were, rightfully I guess.... First of all, there are only 2 restaurants in the hotel: one italian (closed on Sundays) and one open buffet, which serves a la carte if the hotel is half empty, which was our case. And if you're doomed to a la carte, it's just light sandwiches like lobby bar serving... The room service is extremely poor, in a country that can be easily defined as land of plenty for fruits, in september, as season fruits they can serve only apples and bananas. You have to pay 20 Euro per 24 hours of "cabled" Internet, no wireless in the rooms, nor anywhere else except for the lobby; the television set dates end of 1990's if not early 1990's. As for service, the personnel could really not care less for the well being of the clients, they really do not care at all... you have to call them several times to get something fixed in your room... Our experience was really a lousy one, I hope they will fix these problems soon....

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jrfasquelle
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time in Istanbul. I would highly recomend the hotel. There is no complaint about it. Service was excellent and breakfast worth trying. We would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay, great service, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: maverick-brighton
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at th Hyatt Istanbul. Rooms were beautiful furnished and spotlessly clean. The staff were always attentive and cordial. All in all, a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and lux”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Good choice if you want modern comforts. Comfortable beds and big bathrooms. Good but very expensive restaurant - like all the hotel restaurants in Istanbul. Location isn't that great - have to walk across a dark park to Taksim. Can be a long taxi ride to the blue mosque area if there is traffic but the modern hotels tend to be in Taksim anyway. Not as atmospheric as the Bosphorus side hotels but the rates are lower.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends...”
Reviews.Author: 2travelingbugs
Reviews.Content: Before heading to Istanbul, you need to decide if you want to stay in Taksim (which is where the Hyatt Regency is) or in Sultanhamet, where most of the sights are. From the hotel, you need to walk 5 mins or so to Taksim station, take a funicular and then connect to a train to Sultanhamet. If you are there for a few days, it would make more sense to stay closer to the sights. We had friends that went, stayed near the sights, and walked everywhere, whereas we spent some time on public transport. The hotel is nice, no complaints. The staff aren't so helpful or knowledgeable, but it is an annoyance, more than anything, they are certainly not rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great Taksim location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: so_traveller
Reviews.Content: Because my travel partner is a Hyatt diamond member, we got upgraded to a suite and had access to the Regency Lounge as well as the breakfast place on the mezzanie level. Thus, I will leave out the price/value assessment from this review. Location: Excellent. It is roughly 5-10 min walk from the front of the Hyatt to the start of Istiklal Cd, depending on the path you take (through Taksim Park is faster, though we were warn not to walk through the park late at night, and a little bit longer along the Cumhuriyet Cd). Another 7 min or so stroll will get you to Galatasaray school gate, provide you don't stop to smell the kebaps. Also about a 10 min walk downhill to the Kabatas tram stop (likewise, you can take the funicular from Taksim square down but I think it's a waste unless you have mobility issues). About a 10-15 min walk up to the Nisantasi area for high-end shopping (and see the Military Museum where you can watch the Janissary Band perform). It's about an hour walk to Ortokoy, but on a Sunday morning before the traffic hits it's a nice stroll and you get to walk pass Dolmabache and Ciragan palaces. It's really quite central, and if you have 4 days or more, I think Taksim area hotels in general are more convenient than Sultanahmet hotels, especially if you like late nights... Service: Generally very good - professional, helpful, friendly. Although we were with a Turkish speaker, I don't imagine you would have a problem with communication. There's a young lady in the Regency Club who must be commended for exemplary services (and of course I forget her name). She was just very friendly and helpful during the check in process and always has a wonderful smile every time we see her. Food: I suppose food always taste better free, but the breakfast buffet was excellent. Full Turkish breakfast (cheeses, olives, simits, pastirma, fresh fruits, yogurt, etc.) as well as an egg station for omelet and fried eggs. The pastries were very nice. The Regency lounge has water and soft drinks all day, as well as alcohol during between 6-8p. Gym/Pool: Gym is clean, but basic in terms of equipment. There's a sauna and steam in the locker room which is free. It looks nice... The pool space is great. There's hardly anyone using it though. It looks just like the picture on the hotel's website. Room: The standard is about 400 sqft, which is a very good size. If you are on the 9th floor and above, and if your room face the Bosphorus, then you'll get the amazing view. Otherwise, you'll see the city or the university right in front of the hotel. If having the Bosphorus view is important to you, be careful. The suite is large, probably around 700 sqft, much larger than I need but I won't complain. The bathroom with the separate shower stall is deluxe. Overall, this is one of the nicer Hyatt Regency hotels. So if it's within your budget range and you don't expect Four Seasons lux, you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey - obviously - but rather nice...Penguin Family Review.”
Reviews.Author: Penguin_Family_1
Reviews.Content: Of course it's pricey - it's a Hyatt and therefore gets lots of business travellers with expense accounts. But it is quite nice.... Its a standard Hyatt - hotel so should not offer surprises. surprise - the food. Very good quality. The outside barbeque was outstanding. Surprise - The staff were much more friendly than you usually find in a massive corporate hotel. Not surprised -the price. Expensive to stay and ridiculously expensive drinks. (As is often the case, the staff are happy to point you to a local supermarket!) In the middle of the chaos that is istanbul, we were very well looked after. The hotel found us an excellent tour guide and gets particular credit for this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location, Service... but PRICEY”
Reviews.Author: flmiami
Reviews.Content: Great location in Taksim area, within walking distance of many restaurants, shops, other hotels. Beautiful lobby and also the seating areas in the Mezzanine level. Excellent breakfast and lunch buffet. Nice hallways, fast elevators. Comfortable rooms with nice furniture. Very quiet. The A/C works quite well and it's silent. Spacious bathroom with nice shower head, plenty of hot water, and beautiful travertine stone floors and shower walls. The down side is that all of this comes with a high price tag. Two of the nights were EUR 225, and one was EUR 325 (go figure). By the way, the internet access is extra (unless you are a Hyatt Silver or Gold member)

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Jirair
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a total of 6 nights - 2 at the beginning of our Turkey adventure and 4 at the end. The staff & service were impeccable. The food exceeded our expectations. Our room was modern, luxurious, and immaculately kept. Close to Dolmabahce Palace, as well as many restaurants along the Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: supragirl
Reviews.Content: Whilst a little out of the way, this hotel is located in the newer part of Istanbul and is not too far from the main pedestrian street containing a good selection of stores, cafes and restaurants. We requested a room on a high floor with a view of the Bosphorus. Despite there being an international conference on water attracting politicians and other VIPS from around the world, we got our room with the nice view. In fact, we were so well treated at the hotel throughout our four night stay that it made our stay all the more satisfying. Without a doubt, the room we had was beautifully decorated with sculptures and small momentos of Istanbul. The bathroom is one of the largest I've seen. The restaurants we sampled were both excellent, the food and the staff impressed us. However probably the best part of staying at this hotel was access to the sublime spa. Pure magic - unlike any other spa or treatment I have had. This hotel has everything you would expect from a five star hotel. The staff were very attentive, in fact, the conceirge went to great lengths to ensure we had a good time and provided us with list upon list of places to visit and at which to dine. For ease and convenience, we took taxis to old part of town to see the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but really a disappointment relative to what we were told”
Reviews.Author: Ontravel800
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt falls well short of its five stars. When we arrived the room was not yet ready. We waited 45 minutes only to be let to a room with a half empty mini bar and some dirty glasses from the previous guests. When we told the reception they came and took the glasses but no apology. The rest of the stay had many similar examples of bad or mediocre service. The facilities of the hotel good, but not amazing and often too crowded. The breakfast was good, but the first dinner we had was really bad...undercooked food and very , very late. Not worth the money spent

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable but too far from sites.”
Reviews.Author: ssp011204
Reviews.Content: We loved our 4 night stay. Staff were helpful, rooms were large, clean, and comfortable but it is a bit far from Old Town sites. Expect to take a cab to Old Town each day but is in walking distance of Takim Square. Still recommended it to my family but with the caveat that it's not very close to the sites. Make sure you buy turkish delight at Hachi Bekir and eat at Haci Abdullah (ate there twice...awesome food and very helpful staff).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Priya_T
Reviews.Content: great location. very well laid out. rooms were spacious. bathrooms were luxurious. very good breakfast offering. just a 5 minute walk to the capitals nightlife district. overall great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heelbilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. I think the hotel is geared more for business travellers. Good business center and business TV programs. Near Taksim square (beware of rip offs involving shoe shine guys "dropping" their brushes), so close to good doner kebaps and shops. You can walk to a few major sites, but most you will have to take a taxi or funicular/tram. Everyone was more than willing to help with directions and schedules, even though I never saw anyone at the consierge table. Be careful about phone calls. I was charged 65 TL (about $50) for an 8 minute phone call to a cell phone in Istanbul. No one tells you that. Security staff is friendly, and even though you have to walk through a metal detector, it doesn't feel like a hotel that isn't safe. Both my wife and I got spa treatments. Neither was great and facility is a bit sterile. The spa has neon lights that change color periodically. A little too Vegas for me. Staff in spa was friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, with caveats”
Reviews.Author: TWGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the Club Floor (9th), very nice, spacious, comfortable room, with good view (though not of the Bosphorus), large and pleasant bathroom. Continental breakfast was nice although I would advise to stay away from the breads and go for the cold cuts and fresh juice. Location is great as it's near Takism square, from where you can take the Funicular to Kabatas and easily switch to Tram to get to Sultanahmet (old town). Since old town lacks modern hotels, this is a great option if you want a new, modern hotel with a bigger room but still have relatively easy access to old town. Some of the staff on the Club Floor reception seems uninterested and not very efficient, as almost anything you ask them to do , they send you downstairs to the concierge or business center at the ground floor lobby (both of which were often busy and overwhelmed) -- then why bother have a Club Floor at all? One exception was a lady named Iclal, who went above and beyond to help us with our needs ...We are still thankful! However, I would still highly recommend this hotel for its rooms and its location. We didn't try its restaurant, but the room service was decent. My friend also tried the shoe shine service for her shoes (which were badly soiled while touring in Cappadocia) and was extremely pleased when her shoes were returned next morning looking almost new!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: anzio
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 nights trip to Istanbul. We were a group of 6 invlufing 2 boys of 14. The hotel rooms are good sized and with a large marble bathroom. The service is excellent as for the food. Although a big hotel, nights were very quiet and we could not hear any noise from other guests. Very confortble king beds, The hotel stands among other major five stars hotel, but its ottoman style building makes it more cozy. It is within walking distance from the shopping street Istikal Caddesi and Taksim square and from there it is easy to reach the old city by bus or taxi. The room parfume in the lobby is exquisite and the concierge service very prompt and polite. I would certainly reccomend Hyatt Regency for a visit to Istanbul. Jeanne and Prospero C: from Rome, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: eyasan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night, but the experience made it a very special and memorable one! we just loved it! the room was great, really modern and stylish, good internet connection, comfortable beds, oh and I must say that the toilet was out of this world! :) very spacious and stylish... Breakfast was great, soooo many varieties, inside and well as some sort of balcony seating area... very professional staff, offering help with a smile to every one, room service was very efficient and fast, ordered a meal around midnight and it took them nothing to get it ready... I was also amazed by the good English skills of the staff, for those of you who visited Turkey, I am sure you noticed how English is not very well spoken around the country, but in this hotel, all staff were perfectly communicating with everyone with a good English... Location is good too, around 5 minutes walk to Taqseem square, the most vibrant and attractive point of Istanbul. Over all, I'll surely consider this hotel if I visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “a turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: adorable79
Reviews.Content: stayed in room 444 which has a lovely balcony with a side view of the posphore. my friend stayed in suite 442 which has a large sitting area, a desk, dining table and a small well equipped kitchen, a seperate bedroom and walk in closet and a bathroom. the breakfast is a highlight in this hotel. taksim area is less that 10 minutes away. this is my third and definetly not the last in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis between Taksim Square and Nisantasi”
Reviews.Author: texanchef
Reviews.Content: While others are put off by the business nature of the hotel, we stayed for 4 nights over New Year's and were very impressed by the security and helpfulness of the desk clerks. Mahmet was especially helpful, having spent 2 years at the Hyatt Beaver Creek, he had an excellent command of English and American lifestyles. They made outstanding dinner and shopping recommendations and even sent back my razor next day to Texas after we checked out of the hotel without it. The breakfast buffet was first class with both American and Turkish foods to sample. BTW Did I mention that the New year's special was 165 YTL / night - enough reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What I come to expect from Hyatt...”
Reviews.Author: Aceq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a peaceful place with top-notch service that I come to expect from the Hyatt brand. I normally never eat at the hotel restaurants unless it's Hyatt. Here again, the food was excellent, especially local food, their Adana kebab is fantastic - one of the best i've tried in my many trips to various places in Turkey. And when you travel for business, you are normally invited by locals to best restaurants, so I've got a good reference.

Reviews.Title: “Just not good enough”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of this hotel where I only stay if my preferred option in town is not available. Location is good and so are its facilities such as pool and gym. Since the hotel is a relatively low-rise building, the hotel lacks what is most spectacular in Istanbul: the view. Such a pity. My room had two major flaws, non working AC and the 'leaking shower door'. The AC system can not be figured out and rooms are notoriously warm. I think it is some sort of practical joke of bathroom designers to install shower doors that will lead all the shower water into the bathroom and further. It is very rarely that I experience door systems that actually do keep the water inside the shower stall. Thus time I had a new flooding record. I must have taken a shower of 5 minutes and I seriously flooded the entire bathroom. I can not believe hotels don't fix this, it is just so annoying, I just threw all the towels on the floor, I refuse to go on my knees and clean up at a five star hotel. At check out I was lured into giving the full explanation of what was wrong with the shower door, the front desk person who checked me out seemed interested, but you know they couldn't care less and that nothing is done to fix it, three years from now it will be the same and the place will get flooded every single time someone takes a shower. I have now tried this hotel three times and it just doens't feel right, I am just not going back

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kclark9522
Reviews.Content: As others have described the Hyatt Istanbul is a very nice, clean, and upscale hotel. It is an easy walking distance to Taksim Square and Ä°stiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue) where there are many restaurants and shops. From Taksim you can also get the funicular (modern inclined subway) that connects to the tram that stops at all the major tourist sites. When my taxi arrived at the hotel we were stopped at the end of the driveway so that they could use a mirror to look under the car (I assume for explosives). As you enter the hotel you must pass through metal detectors; however, they just waved most people through them. I wasnâ€™t really expecting this security. Internet access was kind of expensive. I think the rates were 10 EUR for 1 hour, 16 EUR for 3 hours, or 30 EUR for 24 hours. Overall, the Hyatt is a top choice in Instanbul.

Reviews.Title: “No Faults”
Reviews.Author: PegasusMiami
Reviews.Content: As a Gold Passport Diamond member, I was upgraded to a 9th floor Regency Club city view room. Check In - fast, efficient, friendly Room (city view) - spotless Quiet Factor - OK - some hallway noise Heat/Air Con - fully functional Bed - soft - needs replacing Bathroom - lighted magnifying mirror, large area, excellent Regency Club - exceptional service, good continental b'fast & super evening cocktails & snacks Check Out - fast, courteous It's a Hyatt business hotel and it delivers on all the standards you expect from a big chain property. No surprises except for the 8% VAT added to the bill on check out.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: Glog
Reviews.Content: Be very careful when you book this hotel. They charge per person per night and not per room. Some of the internet booking engines don't specify and you might end up paying extra at check-out! The front desk does not care and does not know much about online booking (front desk manager did not know Kayak.com).

Reviews.Title: “you cant ask for more”
Reviews.Author: KayaBursa
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt one of the best hotels in Istanbul. I have stayed in many different hotels in Istanbul and when I compare this with other in terms of prices, comfort, location, services etc...I think this is my top choice. Rooms are spacious, bed are very comfortable, the bathroom is very big with a seperate bathtub and shower. The pool is great and the location is perfect. Its in the center of everything you coud ask for. Do not go to the Japanese restaurant below the hotel though, its very expensive and the food is terrible. If you want to eat Japanese food, try MORI located in different parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: WilkoUK
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean. The bathroom is huge with a wonderful 'monsoon' shower enclosure and huge bath-tub. The restraunts are superb, friendly and informative waiters. The common areas are very well laid out and comfortable. The downside... prices for food and drink are astronomical ! Pop around the corner to the 7/11 !!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugtoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights. It is a typical Hyatt property and by that I mean high quality, good service. You know what you are getting. You are safe It is familiar It is quality And that is great if that is what you want/ need. They deliver very good service. Great big rooms Safe food. Very American. And there is nothing wrong with that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ASO82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the weekend. Simply stunning. Forget what people have said about the location - it's perfect! About a 5 minute walk to Taksim Square while still out of the way of all the hustle and bustle. Beautiful hotel lobby and I like the fact that you go through a metal dectector before you fully enter the lobby. Lobby was very nice indeed and clean. Reception staff were fine and helpful. I also like the fact that you can't access the lift without a key card - added security. Had a standard room, which was very large. Immaculately clean throughout. Large double bed which was amazingly comfortable. Desk, sofa, extra drawers etc.. A large TV - although I was surprised that it wasn't a flat-screen one. The best point about the room, for me anyway, was the bathroom. Very spacious and luxurious indeed. Unfortunately, we did not get the chance to check out the restaurant or any features of the hotel due to time constraints, but I'm sure they are just as well mainted and plentiful as the features that we did experience. I will agree with everyone else here and say that the 'extra' prices are extra-ordinarily high! The hotel room wasn't cheap in itself (Â£140 per night) and I know that hotel room mark-up costs are very very very profitable to the hotel - especially at this cost of a room. Therefore, I feel, why the need to then place a simple 330ml can of Coke at 12YTL (Â£5) and a miniture bottle of whiskey at 25YTL (Â£10+) - they must be making well into the 10000+% profit margin on these mark-up prices for extras. The 'standard' breakfast was 50YTL (Â£21). Despite the high cost of extras, I throughly enjoyed my time here and I'd love to stay again and would recommended it to anyone. Just be aware that any extras that you may take for granted elsewhere, i.e. Internet for example, will cost you a lot-of-Lira here.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: martinnyc1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Istanbul with my Turkish boyfriend (I am an American man.) He suggested that we stay at a 5 star international hotel in Istanbul as we were more likely to be treated with respect than if we were to stay in a more local hotel. I chose the Hyatt for three of the four nights (stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Istanbul one night.) as I have always had excellent experiences with Hyatt's in Europe. The Hyatt Regency Istanbul met my expectations. The hotel is large but provides personal service. We were upgraded to club level. Breakfast as well as afternoon snacks and drinks were included. The room was spacious and clean. On the downside the previous reviews are right that prices at the hotel are outrageous and it is a ridiculous waste of money to buy anything to eat or drink there. But you can get by that by walking 5 minutes from the hotel to all sorts of stores and restaurants. Another annoying policy of the hotel (and the Ritz-Carlton too so it may be standard practice) is that prices are quoted in Euros when you reserve the room but you are charged in Turkish Lira when you check out. We were not prepared for that so it slowed down the review of our bill on check out. The upside of staying in a great hotel certainly outweighed the downsides. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a luxury hotel, especially one that I would characterize as gay friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the prices for incidentals”
Reviews.Author: randy33
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul on business for a couple of days. Chose the hotel because of the shortness of the trip and wanted to be comfortable. The hotel has nice facilities, nothing to complain about there. Staff can be a little rude at times. It is the prices of just about everything that I found offensive. Here are some examples: Internet $40/day, laundry (no dry cleaning - pair of pants, underwear, shirt, set of gym clothes) $156, coke or beer $10, breakfast buffet (which they push) $50 per person, transfer to airport in hotel car $130 (a taxi will cost you $30). These prices are all converted to usd. It is these prices that will keep me from ever staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Touches”
Reviews.Author: triphound
Reviews.Content: Having once lived in Istanbul, I was a bit wary before a recent trip about staying in a business hotel there. The Hyatt Regency put those doubts to rest. This is a hotel that revels in its location, rather than shuns it for some American ideal. From the public areas to the dining terrace to the rooms, there are consistent and appealing references to Turkish design, in wood and stone. There are wonderful textures in the room, such as pottery displayed above the bed and screen-like shutters that gently separate the bathroom from the rest of the room. From upper floors you have a magnificent view of sea traffic on the Bosporus, the storied strait that defines this grand metropolis. From the hotel, you can easily walk into frenetic and fascinating Taksim Square and stroll from there to the cafes, restaurants and shops along Istiklal Caddesi, the great social heart of Istanbul. I found the hotelâ€™s staff to be professional and knowledgeable, with solid command of English. High-speed Internet access was easy to get and the room was well set up for work. Donâ€™t miss the small gift shop near the front desk, which surprised me with authentic crafts and a sharp storekeeper who helped me pinpoint the location of an especially tough-to-find local handiwork near one of the cityâ€™s ancient markets. He knew his stuff. The only drawback of the Hyattâ€™s terrific old-Istanbul location is somewhat problematic access to the new business center a few miles north of the Taksim area. This is a relatively minor criticism, though. Taxis are plentiful and if youâ€™re just a bit adventurous, you can even take the subway from Taksim into the new business district and glimpse the flow of life for the average Istanbul commuter. The Hyatt Regency honors the legendary city in which it sits and is worthy of your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but be aware of the price of coffee!”
Reviews.Author: SelinaE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights on a stop over at Istanbul. The hotel staff were friendly and the room was very comfortable and modern . The location of the hotel was very convenient as it itook us about 7 minutes to walk to Taksim Square. The only set back about the hotel was the price of the coffee in their coffeeshop, We felt that it was one of the highest price coffee we have ever seen, it was around US $11 per cup!! Fortunately the hotel provided free coffee and tea service in the room so at least we managed to get our caffeine fix every day without being forced to pay the high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: CHRISSISTAH28
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when i went to Konstantinoupolis (aka Instanbul) because in my mind things were somehow affected by personal beliefs over the years.I was soon very impressed by the size of the hotel and the immediate warmth of the people. As soon as i was guided to my twin room,luxury floated all over the place.It had a huge bathroom with a tub and a shower, a big sink with a basket of goodies for us,a seperate loo and the decoration of marbles and mirrors didn't gave you the impression you were in a hotel bathroom. The room had a wardrobe with a safe and lots of services from washing your clothes to ironing them.It had 2 huge extremely comfortable beds and a desk with free internet access.Also it had 2 sofas and tables like a small living room.Of course tv and a mini bar very equipped although expensive.Be very careful because if you try to take something out the cost is added to your bill at once.I tried to fit some cheese we bought outside and saw on the special channel that you have on the tv,with your account details that i was instantly charged.I called the reception and they took care of it. The hotel offers an amazing breakfast,promised to make you full until dinner.Once again the staff is very polite and warm.Also because you have to be very careful where you eat outside a good suggestion is the 2 restaurants the hotel has,a pricey but lovely Italian and a very good value for money turkish.The Italian is a nice idea for a romantic dinner for a couple.The Turkish is quite nice for lunch also. I would also recomend while staying at the hotel to visit the hamam and the massage rooms,the lovely gym and the very stylish pool surrounded by gardens.. The cost of the twin room was 250 euro,a very reasonable price for the luxury and the service of this hotel.I would definately visit again during a warm month to have the chance to actually dive in the superb pool.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Bar Charges - Has to be a joke”
Reviews.Author: brysal
Reviews.Content: I am at the Hyatt Istanbul and having a great stay. Great property overall, good staff. but I do need to add in comments about the mini bar charges. After reading the othe posts, I laughed when I read the card in the room. Here are a few examples: Coca Cola - 12YTL or $9 USD. Yes, that is for one 12oz can of coke Soda - 12YTL or $9 Small Small Small Evian 12YTL or $9 USD Fruie Juice 12YTL or $9 Potato Chips - 12 YTL or $9 (a small package of pringles) And those are the lowest price items on the list.... Now I have had my share of stays at 100's of hotels for business and pleasure over the years, but NEVER seen items of this type a even 1/2 the cost. Crazy

Reviews.Title: “Great modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business and needed a hotel for a few days since the other was sold out. After staying at the Hyatt for a few days, I wished I didn't need to join my colleagues at the other hotel. The main reason was the room, which was very modern and comfortable. The bathroom was large with both a great tub and fabulous shower. The service was nothing to write home about but it was bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Best room I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JCSide
Reviews.Content: OK, firstly, I will admit this review may be a little biased, as we stayed here after my wife won a competition for a 4-night stay in an Executive room. I therefore cannot really comment on the value-for-money side of things. However, I would like to say that, the free room notwithstanding, our experience was excellent in every way. Location is really good, 5 min walk to Taksim, 10 min to Nisantasi, handy for Bosphorus villages. The hotel building itself is a bit of a monster, built in a 'palazzo' style but completely ruined by horrible smoked reflective windows. It is positively lovely compared to the Intercontinenal and Ritz Carlton however ! Check-in was great, we were upgraded to a suite, and were asked what time we would like to check out on the last day. 2:30 pm was not a problem. The suite was huge, bigger than my first apartment, and was nicely (although blandly) decorated. There was a small kitchen area, a huge living room and bedroom, a large cloakroom and dressing room, and a huge bathroom with walk-in shower. Windows on two sides as it was a corner location, with a view of the pool area. Everything was spotlessly clean, as it was throughout the hotel. All staff were courteous and helpful, and I experienced no problems with surly security at the front door - we were not scanned once. Restaurant reservations and taxi requests were made efficiently. Canapes and drinks in the executive lounge and the buffet breakfast were of excellent quality. I was also surprised that the Turkish wine they served in the lounge was really nice ! I agree with other reviews that the room-service food and hotel restaurants were very expensive, however I would not consider eating dinner in the hotel (unless very pushed for time) with all the nearby restaurants to choose from. Unfortunately the pool area was closed (it doesn't open until June), but I think the weather we experienced was unseasonally warm, so normally there would be no desire to sit outside in April ! It looked very nice though. I would come back in an instant, although next time I will be paying and would probably not stretch to a suite !

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travelxyz
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews I already travelled to istanbul with mixed feelings, in particualr as I have already stayed many times in other Istanbul Hotels such as the Swissotel, The Ciragan Kempinski, The Hilton and the Four Seasons. Howerver, this time it was a long 4 week stay and I was able to get a good deal so that we decided for the Hyatt. The location is good and very convenient but the staff at the reception definelty lacks training and friendliness. The cleaning was EXTREMELY poor. Having complained after 10 nights that the desk hasn't been wiped once and dust was piling up allover the room I just received a stupid reply rather than a professional sorry and after the 26th night it still hasnt been wiped!!!!! Furthermore, certain things (not valueable) disappeared from the room and after having indicated this to the reception I just received another stupid reply and not even an apology. Furthermore,bathrooms and rooms in general are not fitted with the obvious such as cotton pads etc so that we ended up going to the local drugstore piling up on bathroom essentials.... As already indicated by other travellers, the prices for drinks etc in the hotel are extremely high and the food in the restaurants at the hotel is extremely poor! It looks nice, but is fairly tasteless. So overall, I do not recommend to stay at this hotel as there are so many other hotels in the city which are sooooooooooooooo much better in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, issue with staff”
Reviews.Author: AlbertR
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights, in a Deluxe King hotel. The Hotel is very well located a brief 5 minute walk from the Taksim square, and a 10 minute walk from the best shopping area of the city. Location wise I rate it a 5/5. The staff was not at its best during check in (I am not quite sure how much the fact that we are Greek affected them...). I won't go into details, but I would not call the check in "polite and friendly". From there on, all the staff of the Hotel was very nice, but I guess they did not know where we were from... So a 3/5 for the staff. The hotel in general is modern, and well maintained. Yes, there is airport like security at the entrance, but this is standard for all serious hotels in the city, and it does not bother me at all. After all, there have been bombs going off in this city in the past... The room was clean, large, modern, and well appointed. The bathroom was large and included a very nice walk in shower and a bathtub, and has a window to the rest of the room. Not too many nice amenities though. The bed is very comfortable, and there are tons of great statelite TV channels to watch. Also, we got a room with a view towards the street, which also overlooked the sea, which was nice. Overall, the room gets a 4/5. The breakfast is really good, and you should make sure to include it in your rate. Full buffet, with local and international delicacies. 5/5 on this. Overall, the main issue I had was the staff at check in. From there on, a good value if you get a good rate (we paid â‚¬180 / night).

Reviews.Title: “A great business-class hotel off Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoILTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at over 25 Hyatt hotels during the last 10 years, mostly for business travel, and I found the Hyatt Regency Istanbul to have among the nicest Hyatt rooms that I have experienced. I spent 3 nights in February 2007 at the Hyatt Regency Istanbul and found the staff to be professional, attentive and cordial. Yes, the lobby entrance is outfitted with a metal detector portal and bag searches---but I found the Hyatt staff who maintain this operation to be considerate and speedy, not bureaucratic and unfriendly. As an American-franchise business hotel in a city that suffered Al-Queda bombings in 2003 of British and Jewish targets, I think that I understand the reasons for taking extra security measures that may seem unusual for a hotel lobby in other parts of the world. (While I was staying at the hotel, seven of the 2003 bombing suspects were sentenced by Turkish courts to life in prison. Security measures were, perhaps, on higher alert in Istanbul than usual.) The King size bed in my room had wonderful pillows and duvet, a terrific mattress, and great reading lights at hand on both sides of the bed. (I find that many hotels do not pay enough attention to good reading lights near the bed.) The bathroom was terrific: large, marble floor and wall surfaces; a separate shower area (with a large Rain Shower head); a deep-soaking tub; and complimentary use of thick cotton robes. The hotel delivered complimentary coffee to my 3rd floor room each morning. I passed on the room service breakfast---but the staff who delivered the coffee never pressured me to go with the Hyatt breakfast service. Internet service is 20 Euros for a 24-hour period. Not cheap, but the service a dependable and high-speed. As other reviewers have commented, in-room water bottles and mini-bar goods are expensive at this hotel. But I expect that at business hotels. A grocery store around the corner (on Cumhuriyet Caddesi) provided for me lots of choices of liter-size bottles of water, juices and milk, and I simply stocked up on the first day, and used the freely available ice machine down the hall and the wine goblets and glasses in the hotel room to keep myself well hydrated.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Mean Service”
Reviews.Author: DoubleBakedPork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one terrible hotel. Metal Detectors at entrance make you feel like your in airport. The over zealous guards cant seem to remember a safe guest who has entered 20+ times without problem, the staff is mean and not nice. They wouldn't let me have food delivered from outside to the hotel because of what they said were sanitary reasons. Really they just wanted me to buy their overpriced room service instead of a far tastier doner kebap. The rooms have no drawer space for clothes and no iron or ironing board. The bathroom was nice but the shower flawed and bathroom floor was drenched every time I took shower. The room itself was your typical hyatt room. Oh and they tried to charge me an extra 45EURO per night because the claimed I had a guest in my room.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hyatt Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Taskisla Caddesi | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
